name: Grilled West Coast Fish Sandwich

ingredients.name: fresh skinless fish fillets such as cod, snapper, or salmon
West Coast Burger Seasoning or Lemon Dilly Dip Mix

preparation: In a small bowl, combine aioli mix, mayo, and lemon juice, if using. Set aside.
Preheat grill to medium-high. Lightly brush with oil.

With paper towel, pat fish dry. Season both sides with burger seasoning. Place on grill. Grill with lid closed until cooked, about 4 min per side. Add buns for the last 1 min of cooking; grill until lightly toasted. Remove fish and buns from grill.
While fish is resting, using Y Peeler, slice cucumber lengthwise into ribbons. Thinly slice pepper.
To assemble, spread toasted buns with 1 tbsp aioli per sandwich, or more, as desired. Divide fish, cucumber, pepper, and lettuce between buns.
tips: When grilling fish, it’s best to use fresh, firm-fleshed fish such as cod or snapper, or even salmon! Frozen fish that’s been thawed is more likely to break apart.
perfectlyBalanceYourPlate: Serve with 1 cup fresh veggies, your choice.

products.name: Roasted Garlic Aioli Mix
summary: A creamy roasted garlic condiment for your burger, sandwich or use as a dip for fries or veg.

products.name: West Coast Burger Seasoning
summary: A West Coast-inspired blend that's perfect for making salmon burgers after a full day in the sun!

products.name: Lemon Dilly Dip Mix
summary: Beyond being one of our most-loved kid-friendly dips – they love it for dunking chicken strips, fish bites, and veggies – Lemon Dilly is all about versatility. With loads of dill and a hint of lemon zest, it makes an utterly delicious tzatziki and spread for burgers and sandwiches, and levels up everything from salad dressing and salmon to pasta and vegetables.
